intro: Grammosolen odgersii subsp. odgersii, commonly known as the desert lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and open plains. The species is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a hardy and resilient plant in desert ecosystems.
